column3:
Concept ACK

Good catch!

Perhaps worth investigating if you can find any similar cases in:

```
$ git grep -E 'std::numeric_limits<.*>::(min|max)' | grep -vE 'int[0-9]'
```

@achow101 ~~Would you mind to look into [the Travis build log](https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/440074328) to find out the reason of the `rpc_psbt.py ` functional test failure?\nDoes 54a546f brake the code in any way?~~
@hebasto That was likely just a temporary Travis hiccup. I've now restarted the build job :-)

I've investigated in direction pointed by @practicalswift and found two cases which are, IMO, safe to fix (i.e. not belong to the consensus part or other critical parts of the code):

1) this LOC
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/f34c8c466a0e514edac2e8683127b4176ad5d321/src/test/skiplist_tests.cpp#L173
effectively duplicates that one:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/f34c8c4

@practicalswift 
Thank you for your review and a piece of advice.

> Perhaps worth investigating if you can find any similar cases in:
> `$ git grep -E 'std::numeric_limits<.*>::(min|max)' | grep -vE 'int[0-9]'`

It's done. Please re-review.
@gmaxwell \nThank you for your review.\nFixed. Please re-review.
I believe `unsigned int` is 32 bits on all our supported platforms.\n\nACK on the change, but there must be many more places where the size of a unsigned int is assumed?

@sipa 
Thank you for your review.

> ... there must be many more places where the size of a unsigned int is assumed?

Yes. I've found some dozens of them :)
But those cases belong to the consensus part or other critical parts of the code which I'd prefer to not touch.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#14636](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/14636.html) (Avoid using numeric_limits for sequence numbers and lock times by ryanofsky)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one th
I've asked @ryanofsky to pull your changes into #14636, as that PR has more extensive changes, so I'll close this for now.
In this case I think it makes more sense to match the type of `nTweak` (currently `unsigned int`) :-)

`std::numeric_limits<unsigned int>::min() == 0`, therefore, this LOC duplicates that one:\nhttps://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/f34c8c466a0e514edac2e8683127b4176ad5d321/src/test/skiplist_tests.cpp#L169
